subject: Writing
title: The Pentagon Papers
description: Learn The Pentagon Papers in one minute.

hook.text: A military analyst copied 7,000 pages of classified documents and gave them to a newspaper. It changed a war.

buildup.text: Daniel Ellsberg leaked the Pentagon Papers to The New York Times in 1971.

discovery.text: The documents proved that the government had systematically lied about Vietnam for decades.

twist.text: Nixon tried to stop publication. The Supreme Court ruled 6-3 that the press had the right to publish.

climax.text: The case established that prior restraint â€” censoring the press in advance â€” is almost never legal.

punchline.text: One man's leak became the law of the land.

quiz.question: What did the Pentagon Papers reveal?
options: The government had lied about Vietnam for decades
